<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 121, 636, 145]]<|/det|> # Cambridge International AS & A Level <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 170, 195, 201]]<|/det|> CANDIDATE NAME <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 221, 175, 250]]<|/det|> CENTRE NUMBER <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 210, 425, 260]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[620, 220, 720, 250]]<|/det|> CANDIDATE NUMBER <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[735, 211, 905, 255]]<|/det|> <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 277, 178, 293]]<|/det|> ## PHYSICS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 293]]<|/det|> 9702/31 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 359, 317]]<|/det|> Paper 3 Advanced Practical Skills 1 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 301, 905, 317]]<|/det|> October/November 2023 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 326, 905, 341]]<|/det|> 2 hours <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 371]]<|/det|> You must answer on the question paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 700, 401]]<|/det|> You will need: The materials and apparatus listed in the confidential instructions <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 419, 230, 435]]<|/det|> ## INSTRUCTIONS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 890, 605]]<|/det|> INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You will be allowed to work with the apparatus for a maximum of 1 hour for each question.- You should record all your observations in the spaces provided in the question paper as soon as these observations are made.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units. <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 634, 220, 649]]<|/det|> ## INFORMATION <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 730, 682]]<|/det|> INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 40.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ]. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[710, 732, 905, 860]]<|/det|>
For Examiner's Use

Total
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[269, 868, 728, 884]]<|/det|> This document has 12 pages. Any blank pages are indicated.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 72, 739, 89]]<|/det|>
**You may not need to use all of the materials provided.**

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 102, 96, 120]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 581, 120]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate an electric circuit.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 133, 707, 151]]<|/det|>
You have been provided with a wooden strip with wire attached to nails.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 165, 146, 183]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[165, 165, 485, 183]]<|/det|>
● Set up the circuit shown in Fig. 1.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 191, 865, 485]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 497, 532, 515]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 528, 180, 546]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 528, 445, 546]]<|/det|>
F, G and H are crocodile clips.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 559, 702, 577]]<|/det|>
The distance between nail N and G is \(L\), as shown in Fig. 1.1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 590, 641, 608]]<|/det|>
Adjust the position of G until \(L\) is approximately \(40 \text{cm}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 622, 180, 640]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 622, 339, 640]]<|/det|>
Close the switch.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 653, 180, 672]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 653, 578, 672]]<|/det|>
Record \(L\) and the ammeter readings \(I_{1}\) and \(I_{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 712, 917, 732]]<|/det|>
<form>L = ................................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[546, 777, 917, 796]]<|/det|>
<form>I_{1} = ............................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[546, 838, 917, 857]]<|/det|>
<form>I_{2} = ............................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 870, 336, 888]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label> Open the switch.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 884, 920, 903]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Change \(L\) by adjusting the position of G between N and H. Measure and record \(L\), \(I_{1}\) and \(I_{2}\). Repeat until you have six sets of values of \(L\), \(I_{1}\) and \(I_{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 107, 732, 144]]<|/det|>
Record your results in a table. Include values of \(\frac{I_2}{(I_1 - I_2)}\) in your table.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 459, 920, 477]]<|/det|>
<mark>[9]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 490, 143, 508]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 485, 175, 508]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 481, 695, 515]]<|/det|>
Plot a graph of \(\frac{I_2}{(I_1 - I_2)}\) on the \(y\)-axis against \(L\) on the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 490, 920, 509]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 521, 180, 540]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 520, 457, 540]]<|/det|>
Draw the straight line of best fit.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 521, 920, 540]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 551, 180, 570]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 551, 608, 570]]<|/det|>
Determine the gradient and \(y\)-intercept of this line.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[495, 766, 917, 787]]<|/det|>
<form>gradient = ............................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[475, 798, 917, 818]]<|/det|>
<form>y-intercept = ............................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 816, 920, 833]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 72, 740, 90]]<|/det|>
You may not need to use all of the materials provided.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 102, 99, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 792, 121]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the displacement of water from a container.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 133, 144, 152]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 133, 183, 152]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 133, 630, 152]]<|/det|>
The apparatus has been set up as shown in Fig. 2.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[170, 160, 831, 420]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[465, 433, 532, 451]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 2.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 464, 776, 483]]<|/det|>
Ensure that the string passes over the pulley as shown in Fig. 2.1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 495, 920, 530]]<|/det|>
Hang the mass hanger and four slotted masses from the small string loop, as shown in Fig. 2.2.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 536, 865, 838]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[465, 855, 534, 873]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 2.2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 72, 215, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 72, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
Adjust the apparatus until the bottom of the masses is approximately \(4 \text{cm}\) above the floor.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 119, 213, 135]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 119, 920, 151]]<|/det|>
Place the two containers so that the mass hanger and masses hang inside the smaller container, as shown in Fig. 2.3.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[222, 160, 771, 343]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[465, 356, 534, 374]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 2.3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 387, 213, 404]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 387, 920, 450]]<|/det|>
Pull the trolley up the ramp. Ensure that the string runs over the pulley, and the mass hanger and masses hang above the smaller container. Stop the trolley when its back wheels are approximately \(10 \text{cm}\) from the top of the ramp or the small string loop touches the pulley.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 465, 212, 483]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 465, 920, 497]]<|/det|>
Release the trolley. Ensure that the mass hanger and the masses hang inside the smaller container when the trolley stops.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 511, 212, 529]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 511, 697, 529]]<|/det|>
Lift the string, mass hanger and masses onto the bench.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 543, 212, 561]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 543, 808, 561]]<|/det|>
The angle between the ramp and the bench is \(\theta\), as shown in Fig. 2.2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 574, 660, 591]]<|/det|>
Adjust the apparatus until \(\theta\) is between \(10^{\circ}\) and \(15^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 605, 212, 622]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 605, 423, 622]]<|/det|>
Measure and record \(\theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[556, 695, 920, 712]]<|/det|>
<form>\(\theta =\) .................................................... \(^\circ\) [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 727, 181, 744]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 727, 329, 744]]<|/det|>
Calculate \(\cos \theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[520, 820, 920, 838]]<|/det|>
<form>cos \(\theta =\) .................................................... [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 73, 180, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
Without spilling any water into the larger container, completely fill the smaller container with water, as shown in Fig. 2.4.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[324, 114, 672, 227]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[460, 240, 534, 259]]<|/det|>
<mark>[b]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 269, 212, 288]]<|/det|>
<label>EITHER</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 269, 920, 320]]<|/det|>
Hang the mass hanger and masses from the small string loop. Ensure that the string runs over the pulley, and the mass hanger and masses hang above the smaller container.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 333, 212, 351]]<|/det|>
<label>EITHER</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 332, 920, 367]]<|/det|>
Pull the trolley up the ramp. Stop the trolley when its back wheels are approximately \(10\mathrm{cm}\) from the top of the ramp or the small string loop touches the pulley.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 380, 212, 399]]<|/det|>
<label>EITHER</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 380, 920, 414]]<|/det|>
Release the trolley. The masses will fall into the water and water will overflow into the larger container.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 426, 212, 444]]<|/det|>
<label>EITHER</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 426, 697, 444]]<|/det|>
Lift the string, mass hanger and masses onto the bench.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 457, 212, 475]]<|/det|>
<label>EITHER</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 456, 868, 475]]<|/det|>
Measure and record the volume \(V\) of water that is now in the larger container.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 626, 920, 644]]<|/det|>
<form>V = .................................................... $cm^3$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[851, 626, 920, 644]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 657, 181, 676]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 657, 816, 676]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[376, 828, 920, 847]]<|/det|>
